page.title: 05St.Peter's Church.
page.content: These charities were to help the poor families and widows and relief of this kind was an important part of the Church's work, long before the Welfare State came into operation. Today the Church has few secular functions - certain public notices still have to be displayed on the Church door - but continues to be the centre of the religous life of the community. Baptisms,weddings and funerals all take place in the Parish Church,as well as the special festivals such as Plough Sunday, Rogation Sunday and Harvest Festival, which remind us that until quite recently agriculture was the main occupation of the people of Barnburgh.
